Leaf cutters don't make homes out of leaves, as many people believe. Instead they do something even better and much, much cooler: they farm fungi from using leaf cutlets as fertiliser and fungal food. They then feed their literal home-grown crops to their larvae and young. They are agricultural-imperialist lumberers, not primitive leaf house builders. Farming was actually invented about 50 million years ago, not 12,000. We humans merely had the same idea as our ant friends.

It's so interesting how an animal like the ant is individually entirely unimpressive. Both in terms of physical capabilities and intelligence they are not special or are even inferior to so many other animals.
But then as a group they stand out so much in that they are the closest to humans in terms of organization. Offensive and defensive war tactics, agriculture, building large structures to live in, etc.
Despite being so far away from us biologically, they are the only animals that share those things with us.
Close relatives like Bees are similar of course.

I lived outdoors for about three months last year. I was in a large tent and in the surrounding fields and woods there were large numbers of fire ant colonies. For the first two months they never bothered me. I was trying to be a yogi so I didn't kill anything. I consider all life to be equal. During my third month the ants finally found out there were resources in my tent. I did everything in my power to repel them. I would succeed only for a day or two at a time and they would remount another offensive. They wore me down physically, emotionally and spiritually. I prayed to them and did everything I could possibly do that was nonviolent. Nothing worked. After using diatomaceous earth to kill large numbers of them I sat and cried over the thousands of corpses while reflecting on the parallels and similarities it had to human life. As a final act of kindness and hope I started leaving small amounts of food outside my tent and near their nests. They ceased to invade me. I don't know if the ants became my gods (lol) but this was an incredibly powerful lesson for me. I will always respect the ant.

I used to watch a lot of World War II documentaries. And whenever they would talk about how Japan invaded China. They would show the footage of some Japanese tanks rolling through the Chinese Countryside. Also the firing squads, soldiers executing civilians one line of them at a time. I watched many different documentaries and they would always show this one clip of this dog in the background just wandering around being a dog. It didn't know it was on camera, it didn't know it was part of History and it is long-dead now.

Bees are like that they don't know what's going on. We do though.
We can comprehend what's happening in front of us. Great Injustice like firing squads.
The dog was just doing dog things while the Japanese soldiers were lining up the people to be shot.
We can also comprehend Beauty. Most importantly we can comprehend our own death.

Do you think there's anything we can do? Or are we just waiting for the inescapable? Are we all lined up waiting for the bullet of time which never misses?

Anyway, there is a God.
He is actually the one who has sentenced everyone to death.
The Bible calls death "wages"
Which means "payment"
"The wages of sin is death but the gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus."
God is paying us for our sins. Death is our wages.

Have you earned your wages?
If God gives you death would it be payment for services rendered?

What if God paid you a dollar for every time you lied?
Would you have $100? 1000? Ten thousand?

How about using the Lord's name in vain?
Using Jesus's name in place of a four-letter cuss word.
This is called blasphemy, a very serious sin. Would you use your own mother's name as a cuss word?

Try another sin.
Theft. Have you ever taken anything that didn't belong to you?

Are you addicted to pornography?
The average young person in America spend 70 minutes a day on online porn.

I'm taking you through God's Commandments?

Have you earned your wages?
There is good news, though.

God provided you a way to escape death. How?
It's as simple as this, you broke God's laws Jesus paid the fine.

You might disagree with God's chosen punishment. But when Jesus Christ goes to the cross and takes the punishment himself, how can you argue with that?

What you must do is believe and trust that he has taken your punishment. If you do when your physical body dies your spirit will not.

If you refuse to believe. The only alternative is hell.

Я рождён ещё при союзе, в 1987 -м году и как я понимаю, радио имплантанты ставились в роддоме всем и об этом, родителей, в известность не ставили+прививки, (в сведетельстве о рождении, этого, не написано), (прививание в тело человека, посторонних одноклеточных организмов, а потом начинаются желтухи, краснухи, пяточные шпоры, киста, ветрянки, полипы, раки, бородавки и прочий геморой)! Нет ни какого, бога! Раздупляйтесь! Если вы, видите сновидения, это значит, в теле, есть радио-устройства! Человек, без имплантантов, сновидения не видит, сон, является просто спокойным ночным отдыхом! И утром, проснувшись, нету заморочек, что за сновидение и что бы это могло значить! Программка всячески отвлекает и от медитаций (на уроках, в школе меня тоже отвлекала и при домашних заданиях, когда надо было думать) и морочит голову! Масоны, это кремлёвские спецслужбы! Они по одному работают в роддомах и воинских частях, они на отдельных правах, почему-то, сидят в отдельных кабинетах и контролируют через програмку, по месту, тех кого нужно, пользуются тем, что общество не знает про эти технологии, подписывая контракт о нерозглашении! А ещё, в помощь вам металло искатель, желательно мощный, так как детальки маленькие. Garrett 400 на личном опыте срабатывает на эти импланты! Населению частных секторов вообще нет ни минуты покоя! Есть ещё в интернете такая тема как, Менталитет Краба - Crab Bucket Theory, и тема эта работает через эти же имплантанты и подставные мысли, если вы ведётесь на эти мысли и необдуманно сразу действуете, вы сбиваете или отвлекаете человека, который не сидит в этом ведре. Вот вам и жизнь с богом в душе!)А на деле занозы в теле! Поэтому в жизни всё как то не так как хотелось бы! Вообщем, какой Кремль такие и мы! Если вам в себе что то не нравится, понимайте, это кремлёвские настройки! И многие не понимают почему! Всё же вроде делаю нормально и стараюсь.)Не было на этой планете эволюции! Прилетели сюда! Но почему-то, не всё сразу дано знать потомству! Рассказ про Адама и Еву, на самом деле, это интересная Загадка! Змей искуситель это внутренний голос (радиоимплантанты) в теле! О том, что имплантанты в теле (кстати и у Адама тоже) они не знали. Повелась, Ева, на якобы запретный плод, потому, что в википедии написано Слушай подсказки внутреннего голоса! Изгнана за это из рая (лишена прав хранительницы домашнего очага, спокойной личной и стабильной семейной жизни, саморазвития) загнана на работы, на церковные сказочные богослужения, неестественная самооценка! Спецслужбам, что бы управлять кем-то, нужно сначала сделать его,её виноватым (грешником). Программа эта, работает по всем одинаково, по сей день....
Если тебе изначально назвать биологические часы, по другому, постепенное окисление и до старости не доживают а доводят себя сами! (Тут еще работает понятие, утро вечера мудренее! За ноч чуть восстановился!)Что ты будешь делать? И еще, любая кислотность, витамины в том числе, повышают давление!

I have followed the raid of one species of Army Ants and watched dozens of Pheidole Ants nest get looted and hundreds of Pheidole Ants getting killed. Ever since I was a kid, I always wanted to make a video game called The Rules ofNature: Insect Warfare. The game would have different game modes where every player plays as an insect in a shooter style game. This would be the main gamemode, with red ants having red leaf bases and outposts, and green ants having green leaf bases and outposts. It would play like Battlefield but the maps would be in trees. The ants would mainly melee but you could also spit acid.

Another game mode would be bees vs wasps. I would try to keep the game as realistic as possible, but obviously I'd have to take some liberties to make the game more fun and playable. And don't worry, there wouldn't be any spiders.

Imagine the attacking team has to take over outposts (slowly capturing them when there are no enemy ants in the area). Once all outposts are captured, they can attack the main base where one player can become the Queen who has special abilites and more health. Destroying larvae would reduce the enemy team's reinforcements (like Battlefront 2017) and you win by either killing the queen, destroying the enemy base, or wiping out every enemy ant. 100 vs 100.

When you first start the game, the very first thing you saw would be an option; PG Mode, or True Nature Mode.

PG Mode would make the game more PG.

True Nature Mode would allow blood, dismemberment, and brutal takedowns and death animations.

I am a bit puzzled toward the number of ants and the biomass they represent. If there are 10,000 trillions ants, they are 1,250,000 ants per humans. I find the average mass of an individual ant is 4 mg. If with these number you calculate the biomass of ants, you find there are about 5 kg of ants per humans on Earth (4 mg x 1,250,000 = 5 million mg = 5 kg). From that perspective, it seems ants cannot represent 20 % of the terrestrial animal biomass.

It is an unknown millennium since the dawn of life. For more than 64 million years, successive queens has sat immobile on the Burrowed Throne of the hive. They were the Masters of our antkind by the will of the gods, and masters of millions of ants by the might of their inexhaustible will. The current queen is an ever-pregnant individual laying eggs in the dark chambers of the breeding tunnels. She is the Mother of the Hive for whom a thousand souls are sacrificed every day, so that our home may never truly die.




Yet even in Her swollen state, the Queen continues Her lifelong duty. Mighty armies cross the daemon-infested environment of the grassy expanse, the only route between distant colonies and sources of food, their way marked by the scent trails, the chemical manifestation of the Queen's guidance. Vast armies give battle in Her name on uncounted grounds. Greatest amongst Her offspring are specialized ants, the soldier ants, bio-engineered super-warriors. Their comrades in arms are legion: the worker ants and countless colonial defence forces, the ever nurturing nursery ants and the highly productive drones to name only a few. But for all their multitudes, they are barely enough to hold off the ever-present threat from enemy ants, predatory arthropods, ravenous animals - and worse.




To be an ant in such times is to be one amongst untold billions. It is to live in the cruelest and most bloody existence imaginable. These are the tales of those times. Forget the dreams of simpler times and a peaceful existence, for so much has been forgotten, never to be re-discovered. Forget the promise of peace and understanding, for in the grim dark future there is only war. There is no peace upon the ground, only an eternity of carnage and slaughter, and the laughter of sadistic titans.
And now, presenting: War of the planet of the ants.

Have humans on a primitive world, in crazy warring kingdoms who all serve their queens and do magical dances to summon allies or cast protection spells. They could scavenge for sweet nectar from great fountains and war for the best goods. Crazy dance battles where certain movements cast spells, you could have awesome breakdancing throwing spells as they spin, or something ridiculous and cool like that lol (that could look really cool, or really stupid. Here's an interesting story about why I hate ants

One day when we were with scouts camping in European Alps on a hot summer day, our scout leader, whatever you whanna call it gave us a challenge

The challenge was to pack things up and head directly to the highest peak we could climb and take a group selfie and then return the next day

Since our campsite was in a V shaped valley we had a long way to get to the peak

After 6 hours of walking up the mountain we found a farm, which was right next to the peak. We went by, took a group selfie, returned back and made a deal with the local farmer for an exchange of our labor he would provide us with a meal and a place to sleep in the barn.

We helped him out with some task, got our meal and some food for the next day and headed to sleep

The next morning he advised us to take his path down the mountain.

We took his advice and decended down the mountain

But as we were in decending the path was getting smaller and smaller and the angle of the mountain steper and steper.

At some point we had to slide on our buts to make it safely downwards. It was one heck of a dangerous experience.

My friend got hit by a falling rock about the size of a tennis ball, unfortunately it landed right on his head and knocked him out for a second. He was ok later, thankfully

But the same could not be said for me, because when we were sliding down I landed face-forward into a giant surface ant colony

I had ants of what appeared to me an enormous size all over my body. They were crawling in my ears, nose, hands, legs, and even the pp area

I was so traumatized after that encounter that even now 2 years later if I see an ant crawling on me I scream like a teenage girl, for which my friends laugh at me

I will never forget what happened that day and I truly hope this doesn't happen to me ever again or others around me

P:S sorry for spelling errors, I'm on an phone and it's late so quite frankly I'm too lazy to correct anything right now

If humanity lived on the interior of a Dyson sphere constructed with alien materials and technologies that are well beyond anything with which humanity can come up, would we still fight over essentially unlimited resources until we spread across the entire sphere, or would we at first live in harmony, then fight as our population approaches the high quintillions?

For people to think that humans alone have some special place in the universe where they go after they die is arrogance and hubris. Who are we to claim an infinite paradise over all other sentient life? We’ve only existed in this current state for the blink of an eye in the cosmic timeline. Meanwhile other forms of life have been slogging it out for eons. Yes we’re at the tip of one branch of the evolutionary tree, but there are so so many other branches. I mean, we can only understand our own concept of intelligence by labeling it the ability to think in certain ways, but who’s to say that a passing alien wouldn’t look straight past us and towards bacteria or mycelium as a more interesting example of evolved life? Should an ant have its own eternal after life with its own god in its own heaven? The very fact that we have these religious ideologies is testament to the fact that we can only perceive the universe around us from our limited mammalian perspective, and we most definitely do not hold some special place as the pinnacle of “creation” or “children” of any given deity.

It's my first time here since I heard Jacksepticeye mention this channel in passing recently so when I saw the already quite interesting thumbnail being recommended to me the memory of the wierd channel name made me check it out.

Honestly this notion didn't really need that lead-up but I felt needed to share that it's my first time here and that's why I thought about the name without any prior knowledge. But here it comes:
I'm assuming it's German both because of how it sounds but also because you've heard jokes about single German words that describe a really specific thing before and since I'm Swedish that have some similar words that English doesn't really share so I think "Kurzgesagt" literally means the same as "Kort sagt" does in Swedish. They sound very much alike and with the "in a nutshell" hint it's even more obvious, if that's correct I can share that it just means "short said" and isn't much of a "mystery that cannot be translated" if anyone were curious, it's basically just that you're telling the short version rather than the long version. Or "in a nutshell" I guess but just when it's about summarizing and not short versions in general.

I've watched one live when I was young because our Mango tree here in Philippines is like a hub for multiple colonies (i think, dunno, not sure) most of them were small and black colored, then one morning I went out at the back of our house I saw lots of big red ants at the foot of the tree with a mix of black ants with them, I looked in near out of curiosity and I saw most of the black ants are in half or plain dead but some are swarming some of those big red ants, we call the big red ones "Antik" or "Han-tik". It's like a CGI hollywood army battle from my memory lmao. so sad the hub doesn't exist anymore, the tree is still there but it's not like before because it was uprooted due to a Super Typhoon and was just replanted and now the ground is full of "Lumot" or Moss. This video does make me wonder, however, how many species army ants have driven to extinction, how much ecological "damage" ants do in general, etc. I know usually people view things only as negative if a human does it, but I'd think knowing whether the ants are amplifying soil erosion, disrupting ecosystems, and doing things that might threaten our food sources or similar would be useful.


Thinking of ants (most species anyway) as individuals makes a lot of what they do confusing. It all makes more sense if you view ants instead as cells in a single superorganism. The colony is the individual.

Three reasons this is my favorite channel on YouTube:
1. They take their time to make their videos, and it shows. The animation is solid, and they clearly are doing their research. They don’t upload too often, but when they do, it’s amazing.
2. They turn scientific subjects into very exciting and entertaining videos. I have never before this been excited to learn about ants.
3. The comments section isn’t filled with people begging for likes
There’s a reason why they’re one of the only science channels close to 10M. I think the only science channel to hit 10M is Vsauce, who I enjoyed watching almost as much as kurzgesagt, although all he does now is his YouTube premium show…

so a small story



I study ants as a hobby, and I noticed that ants were running away from a certain area in a small bush. Later, I observed some ants walking in the bush, I found out that a colony of smaller ants were attacking bigger ants (the colony I was studying) but they always ran when its was a single ant encountering the bigger ant. When they were in a range of 3-6 ants, however it was a whole different story, the ants attacked the species and treated the ant like prey (they start from dragging on the legs, then weakening it and using it as food). I was confused by this so I did research, I discovered this video and it let up information to me and answered some pretty big questions that I was asking.

Kurzgesagt, thank you for making this video!

Edit 1: The bigger ants don't attack the smaller ants.. Even if they are far from the colony.

This one goes out to all those people who claim to be all about nature and "animal aficionados" while at the same time uttering that ridiculous "humans are the worst because they are the only species that start wars" nonsense.

Half of the animal kingdom has intra and extra species war (most social insects as well as social mammals such as lions, hyenas, and primates) and it's practically always for the same reasons as our wars (territory and resources... food being the usual resource for them). Only difference between our wars and theirs is that we have the brain power to make our wars more "efficient" with technology.🤣

Once when I was a kid this huge patch of dirt road had been swarmed by large soldier ants. Upon further inspection I noticed that each side of the road had a single ant colony, and that the ants had turned the road itself into their battleground. Each ant had been paired off with an enemy ant and had locked jaws. A few hours later the road was covered in dismembered bodies and the ants left alive were dragging the dead back to their colonies. Pretty narly.

The more I learn about the animal kingdom, the more I appreciate the problems I have going on in my life. It's easy to complain and have breakdowns over the stuff that happens in your life but then when you compare it to animal life, you realize how good you really have it.


Take relationships for example. Some men feel like their life is over when they find out another man is sleeping with his special lady... then you look at Lions... When another man comes to take your girl in the lion species, he kills you, kills all of your children, and then the mothers of those children have to breed new kids with this murderous imposer. Can you imagine that crap being normal in your human life? With us, if you git your girl stolen you sulk for a while and find the courage to go get a new girl and maybe better your life in the process. I bet lions wish they could do that instead of having half their family mauled to death.


Despite how deep we get into our own negative feelings, we really do have it good as far as living animals on this Earth are concerned and I feel like we forget that... OFTEN

Can you clarify what you meant by biomass?

If there are ten quadrillion (1*10^13) ants, measuring at about 3 milligrams (3*10^-3 grams) each, and ~8 billion (7.7*10^6) humans at about 55 kilograms (5.5*10^4) each, then the numbers break down to 3*10^10 grams of ants and 42.35*10^10 (or 4.235*10^11) grams of humans.

Humans outweigh ants in terms of body weight by a bit more than a factor of ten.

It is the 3rd Millennium. For more than a hundred million years The Empress has sat immobile on the Golden Throne of Earth. She is the Master of Antkind by the will of the gods, and master of a million colonies by the might of her inexhaustible armies. She is a rotting carcass writhing invisibly with power from the Dark Age of Technology. She is the Carrion Lord of the Imperium for whom a thousand souls are sacrificed every day, so that she may never truly die.


Yet even in her deathless state, the Empress continues her eternal vigilance. Mighty armies cross the vertebrate-infested miasma of the Earth, the only route between distant colonies, their way lit by the Antronomican, the psychic manifestation of the Empress's will. Vast armies give battle in her name on uncounted colonies. Greatest amongst her soldiers are the Adeptus Antartes, the Ant Marines, bio-engineered super-warriors. Their comrades in arms are legion: the Imperial Guard and countless colony defence forces, the ever vigilant Inquisition and the tech-priests of the Adeptus Mechanticus to name only a few. But for all their multitudes, they are barely enough to hold off the ever-present threat from predators, heretics, mutants - and worse.


To be an ant in such times is to be one amongst untold billions. It is to live in the cruelest and most bloody regime imaginable. These are the tales of those times. Forget the power of technology and science, for so much has been forgotten, never to be re-learned. Forget the promise of progress and understanding, for in the grim dark present there is only war. There is no peace amongst the Earth, only an eternity of carnage and slaughter, and the laughter of thirsting gods.

I have one suggestion:  diatomaceous earth -- food grade. 

Buy it online, or at almost any hardware store, and dust wherever ants are making your home into a battleground.  It kills them--not instantly, but over a few days they'll all be dead, dead, dead.  Fleas, too, and wasps and other insects. 

Birds like it mixed with their suet; helps them form good eggshells.

We had colonies of ants under the house and inside  walls--used the "blow" function on our shop vac and blew the powder under the whole house and up into the walls.  Within a week they were completely dead.  It damages their exoskeletons/dries them out completely. 

If it gets wet, it works again after it dries.  We keep it handy now and at the first sign of a new nest, we dust immediately.  And it's safe to eat for you and your pets.  Just don't breathe it, any more than you'd breathe in flour or talcum powder.  It also kills fleas in carpets and furniture and even right on your pets. 

Keep it out of your eyes as much as possible.  But it's non-toxic in terms of skin contact and ingestion.  You can add it to your food and pet food--the food grade kind is really just calcium...ground up diatom skeletons from the ocean.  It's chalk, really. 

 Also excellent for your garden as a fertilizer additive.  You oughta see our tomato plants!  They love it!

Ants are wasps, or same ancestor... That's why most species have males and queens that have wings to fly to start a new colony. They didn't evolve wings, they just don't need them except for that one instance.


Also "An ant alone is nothing"... Boy would an ant be insulted to hear that. Sure an ant by itself would die - no colony, might not even be able to eat outside food, etc. But meeting other insects save specialty predators most run from it or avoid it, even ones 3-4 times their size. Or more... If they try to eat it it will fight back hard and likely its friends will come by and eat them, but save things gargantuan to them like anteaters or specialized like antlions again most other insects (and animals) just avoid them.

As someone quite knowledgable in ants, I can say this video is pretty accurate xd

Edit: I can really only point out two inaccuracies; usually it's genera like Cephalotes and Colobopsis that plug up their nest entrances with majors' heads, and ants don't sting by turning around and poking. Instead, they grab on with their mandibles, and pull their gasters under and around to sting. There are some occasions where species which can release toxic fluids will turn around to swing around a droplet of said fluid, but that's usually unrelated to stinging.

Freshman year of high school, a friend was outside the library (it was an open-air campus) sitting and staring at the ground. I asked him what he was doing and he said he was watching some ants. There were a couple red ants and a couple black ants that had just crossed paths. I stayed and watched them, too. One red ant kind of “met” with one of the black ants they touched feelers. Then, they went their separate ways and their buddies followed them. About a minute or two later, two large groups of ants, one of red ants and one of black ants, maybe as much as 100 or more each, met on the exact spot on the concrete that the first red and black ants met and started slaughtering each other. There was no clear winner and both sides eventually retreated, after losing about 2/3 of their armies. It was mind-blowing.

What you're describing isn't war, but predation. War is organized group combat within the same species. The term also encapsulates a mental state of open hostility, where members go out of their way to attack the other side. This can be easily confused in ants because of superficial similarities. However, you have to remember that they are many individuals acting in unison, effectively acting as a single organism. The objective is to find food, not eradicate every member of the other ant species.

IMO, the fact that you and the researchers who vet your material confuse war with predation betrays civilization's influence on you. From the beginning, our civilization set us at odds with the world, telling us that the world was made for us, and we were made to rule it. Since nature did not willingly submit to our rule, we began doing what any ruler does to subjects that don't submit: we began conquering it. And to this day, we are still trying to conquer the world ("conquering disease", "conquering space", etc). Simply put, we are at war with the world.

Therefore, when we see species experiencing tactical battles similar to ours, we describe it as war. But never would we describe a pack of lions as being "at war" with gazelles. Both cases are simply predation, plain and simple. The similarities with our armies and fighting style are a mere coincidence.

I strongly recommend that everyone on your staff read the Ishmael series (4 small books) by Daniel Quinn. Your videos are wonderful and insightful… except when you unwittingly regurgitate civilization's mythology.

"Humans have deceided that war is not a thing that want to do a lot anymore" ?? °° We live in a time where there is more conflicts/wars than at any time before. No wars is a wishfull thinking. It is true less people are killed because the technology level between the war factions is often greater than before = the deaths are on one side mostly. E.g. there were so many casulties in WW1 and WW2 because equally strong combatants were fighting (WW1 trench war) or one of the countries involved didnt care for its people (like Soviet Union supplying 1 rifle to 5 men for assaults).



Therefore "deaths in a war/conflict" is not a good way to count/judge if humans become "more peaceful".





And wars have nothing to do with "dont like someone" but with gaining power = land, resources, money, influence.

Untill today I didn't know I wanted to learn about ants soooo bad.

Day 142, WW7
The army ants attacked again but we managed to repel them, George and I were assigned to a detachment, 55 cm from the colony. We were 300 ants strong with a few thousand workers on their way to reinforce us. They came at us at dawn, I saw George charging with the workers he's leading. I was ordered to hold the rear in case we had to retreat. Of the 250 ants that engaged the enemy, only three returned. And there he was, George, his head clean off, his body standing on top of dozens of army ants. He kept babbling about dying like a hero for the Queen and Colony, stupid idiot. We were ordered to pull back to guard the gates of the Colony. The Gates!? What happened to the main army? They were supposed to hold out 2 meters away from the colony.

Day 151, WW7
The main army.... is gone. The last surviving soldier ants are to aid the workers in barricading the entrances into the colony. The Queen and her eggs are to be transported in the deepest chamber of the colony.

Day 152, WW7
Ant-Christ help me, I hear them trying to break the barricades. Is this it? Is this the end?

Day 153, The Last Day of the Colony, WW7
They're in the colony, I can still hear the screaming of the worker ants getting butchered. We were ordered to hold out in the Queen's chamber. The Queen is shaking in fear. I can hear the other ants pounding against the barricade we made yelling: "Help us! Let us in!" then followed by screams of pain and then silence. They are going to smash that barricade anytime now, I'm sorry George, the colony is lost. I'll finally see you in Ant-Heaven. Ant-God save the Que....

Really happy about this. I've found ants fascinating for years, and I live in an ant rich region. We regularly see two species of army ants, and I've raised leafcutter ants too.

There are two species of army ants here, one is that species with the yellow head, another looks like a small black ant but they come in thousands. When foraging, the smaller species forms a front line that is one meter wide and up to four meters deep. This frontline moves at an incredible speed, and you can see insects and small animals attempt to flee. Birds will follow the group to try to catch any escaping insects. Once saw a small lizard flee in the wrong direction, right to the middle of the battlefront. It died pretty quickly.

I'v accidentally stepped in the middle of that same battlefront. Not a pleasant experience.

Ten thousand trillion? That sounds so clunky. Why not say ten quadrillion? Some people would say 10 million million. ugh There are words for the large numbers. Why don't people use them? Science videos always say things like one million million billion. Why not say one sextillion. The common reply (because I bring this up every time I see it) is that most people just don't know what these numbers mean. They don't know what a million million billion is either. They hear "very large number". The same as they'd hear if you said "one sextillion". Maybe to help them get it, say "one sextillion. That's a 1 followed by 21 zeros".
It's absolutely trivial. I don't know why it bugs me... Anyway. We now return you to your regularly scheduled program.

As much as animation is the style of a typical Kurzgesagt video, I think that for actual real life representation that can be and have been captured by camera, should be used alongside the animation.The research and presentation though detailed, is made too simple by the animation. The colours aren't accurate and the visuals are too scripted. It doesn't do justice to a well researched topic. I love the clarity and brevity of the animation, but I'm afraid it takes too much away from the presentation.
For example, at 4:26, I think an actual real life depiction would create a better imagery. When I search online to see the atta cephalotes, they look more threatening than the animated version.
At 4:48, the nomamyrmex esenbeckii anatomy diagram is again too simplistic. It looks similar to other ants featured in the video, but in reality they look like an alien species, almost crustacean like. Perhaps in the animation/editing, we can see a side by side comparison of the real life and animated version, to get a better representation of the anatomy before isolating the specific parts in the animation.

In previous videos, your style of animated videos works well when introducing and explaining ideas that are not easily pictured/video documented. (Politics, philosophy, space, and microscopic etc.) I especially liked the recent video on the complement system because there are no actual captured pictures/videos of it, only ever done in graphics. And you guys blew it out of the water by animating it, making it much simpler and more detailed at the same time.

We don't consider mammals to be a colony of cells, which it is, but we see a single contiguous organism, even if a single individual comprises a multitude of cell line species.

So, should ants be better classed as a separated or divided organism ?

An individual ant is the minimal size assemblage for a functional to the organism unit, just as a single red blood, muscle, or nerve cell would be to us, but the true organism is the entirety of the community, whether connected as a single assemblage or divided being.

It is the 3rd Millennium. For more than a hundred days the queen has sat immobile in the royal chamber of the nest. She is the Master of Antkind by the will of the gods, and master of a million squares by the might of her inexhaustible armies. She is a fat body writhing invisibly with power from the abdomen . She is the immobile lady of the hive for whom a thousand souls are sacrificed every day, so that she may never truly die. 

Yet even in her immobile state, the Queen continues her eternal vigilance. Mighty cohords cross the human-infested concreate of the city, the only route between distant organic waste cans and the nest, their way lit by the hormones, the psychic manifestation of the Queen's will. Vast armies give battle in her name on uncounted worlds. Greatest amongst her soldiers are the Adeptus Formica, the Soldier ants, bio-engineered super-warriors. Their comrades in arms are legion: the worker ants and countless nest defence forces, the ever vigilant overseers and the nurse ants of the Adeptus maternitate to name only a few. But for all their multitudes, they are barely enough to hold off the ever-present threat from humans, soldier ants, mutants - and worse.

To be an ant in those times is to be on among countless millions . It is to live in the cruelest and most bloody regime ever. Those are the tales of those times. Forget the power of evolution, for it takes it's time. Forget the promise of progress and peace, for under the grim dark city there is only war. There is no peace among the ants, only an eternity of carnage and slaughter, and the laughter of the thirty men.

Kurzgesagt: A N T S

Now, listen, dont get me wrong, i love peace as much as the next guy, and i do in fact think that the warmongering nation states on Earth do is basically thanks to psychopathic bloodthirsty fucks in power who have no value as human beings, nor should even deserve to be called human, because 99% of the entire human population on earth are in fact civilians who never murdered or raped anyone in their entire lives, war and murder is an ABBERATION, not the norm.

HOWEVER..... One could argue that war, even with technological civilizations, is a part of darwinian evolution (as it is with these ants and other species in the universe). In some twisted fucked up way, one might even argue that interstellar warfare isnt "necessarily" a bad thing, but merely darwinian evolution continued and aided by technological innovations, weeding out the chaff until the most ingenius strong species survives.

Obviously, i dont WANT that to be the case, i WANT interstellar civilizations having reached such a status to be peaceful diplomatic utopias. But i'm just playing devils advocate here, it could very well be the case that "darwinian war" is something that never stops cropping up, no matter how far a species has evolved.
And perhaps that's what the universe simply does, pits species against each other to evolve the most intelligent and tenacious one.

This video illustrates why I find the sci-fi and fantasy trope of criticising humanity for being warlike so annoying.

A. We know no other sapient species, certainly no other with our numbers and societal complexity, so why do we assume we are particularly violent? We have sample size of one to make comparative judgements about.

B. Chances are, if and when we do encounter other sapient life, they will also fight each other, or have fought each other in their past. It's a behaviour that is so common in social life on earth, that it seems hard to imagine they would be completely devoid of it (unless we stumble upon space bonobos who resolve most conflict by having copious amounts of sex....)

Ants can be so painful when they attack because of the numbers. Once I was walking inside a no man's land densely covered with wild plants and trees. I knew that there was a larger nest of weaver ants as many roamed around the wall. One fine day I thought of going inside it and wander. Tommy suprise it was denser than I thought. I was careful not to touch any tree as there were many  weaver ants on them. Seconds later I found the corpse of a dead cat(seemed fresh as no smell was coming out of it). Many ants were on it...many going in and out through the holes.I was shocked to see it and my neck accidently touched a hanging branch. Within seconds of contact 10 to 15 ants were inside my clothes biting me every place possible. I started to run out of the place in panic and pain. When I got out I was trying to take all the ants out...people around me thought I was slapping myself. It took me a while as I was not thinking of taking my clothes off...for years whenever I see ants especially red ones I feel some kind of sensation in my skin.

Wait wait wait, the math doesnt quite check out.
According to most sources, ants weigh between 1 and 5 milligrams. If there are about 1250000 ants per human those 1250000 ants would weigh about 2.5 kg (assuming about 2 milligrams per ant since im pretty sure there are more smaller ants than bigger ants).
The average person weights about 70 kg so that would mean humans make up 28 times more of the total biomass than ants. Which isnt possible if ants make up 20%.

Additionally, lots of sources state human and ant biomass to be approximately the same. So... one of those numbers doesnt work.
